A: You can use the following code to add a UTF-8 BOM (Byte Order Mark) to a file:

```java
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.IOException;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String filePath = "path/to/your/file.csv";
        try (FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(filePath)) {
            // UTF-8 BOM
            fos.write(0xEF);
            fos.write(0xBB);
            fos.write(0xBF);
            // Rest of your data
            fos.write("Your data here".getBytes("UTF-8"));
        } catch (IOException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
```

Please note that if you are writing to a database BLOB, you should consider the encoding when you read the data from the BLOB. The encoding should match the one you used to write the BOM.

```sql
ALTER SESSION SET NLS_CHARACTERSET = 'UTF8';
```

```bash
-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8
```
